title: Selenous acid - why Ka2 is smaller than Ka1

Step 2:  HSeO 3 − (aq)⇄ SeO 3 2− (aq)+ H + (aq)   K a 2 =5.3× 10 −9 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaahGart1ev3aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbi aabIeacaqGtbGaaeyzaiaab+eapaWaaSbaaSqaa8qacaaIZaaapaqa baGcdaahaaWcbeqaaiabgkHiTaaak8qacaGGOaGaamyyaiaadghaca GGPaGaeSiXHaOaae4uaiaabwgacaqGpbWdamaaBaaaleaapeGaaG4m aaWdaeqaaOWaaWbaaSqabeaacaaIYaGaeyOeI0caaOWdbiaacIcaca WGHbGaamyCaiaacMcacqGHRaWkcaqGibWaaWbaaSqabeaacqGHRaWk aaGccaGGOaGaamyyaiaadghacaGGPaGaaGzbVlaaywW7caWGlbWaaS baaSqaaiaadggadaWgaaadbaGaaGOmaaqabaaaleqaaOGaeyypa0Ja aGynaiaac6cacaaIZaGaey41aqRaaGymaiaaicdadaahaaWcbeqaai abgkHiTiaaiMdaaaaaaa@6163@

The step-wise dissociation of selenous acid, H2SeO3(aq), is represented by the equations above. Which of the following best helps explain why the value of K a 2 is so much smaller than the value of K a 1 ?

choices.label: The Se atom in H2SeO3(aq) is in a higher oxidation state than the Se atom in HSeO3-(aq) .
Water is more attracted to HSeO3-(aq) ions than to SeO32- ions, which drives the step 2 equilibrium toward the reactant.
The HSeO3-(aq) ions produced in step 1 are asymmetrical, but the SeO32- ions produced in step 2 are symmetrical.
Removing the first H+ from H2SeO3(aq) requires less energy than removing the second H+, because the second H+ is removed from a negatively charged species.

topic.text: 8.6: Molecular Structure of Acids and Bases

skill.text: 6.C: Support a claim with evidence from representations or models at the particulate level, such as the structure of atoms and/or molecules.
